meanings.def: on one occasion only; one time
examples: I've only been there once.
He cleans his car once a week.
She only sees her parents once every six months.
For optimum effect, these drops are used once daily.
I had met Lou once before.
Last year the region received rain only once.
(informal) He only did it the once.
Rome is a city you should visit at least once in your life.
They meet once a week at a Paris café.

meanings.def: at some time in the past
examples: I once met your mother.
He once lived in Zambia.
This book was famous once, but nobody reads it today.
She remembers once travelling with her father to Kilkenny.
I famously once said that I was a fighter and not a quitter.
He once told an interviewer that his biggest regret was missing his father's funeral.
It was once thought to be the best hotel in Europe.

meanings.def: used in negative sentences and questions, and after if to mean ‘ever’ or ‘at all’
examples: He never once offered to help.
If she once decides to do something, you won't change her mind.

meanings.def: used with a preposition or another adverb to mean ‘as soon as somebody/something is/was’
examples: Once inside the gate, Sam hurried up the path.

meanings.def: suddenly
examples: All at once she lost her temper.

meanings.def: all together; at the same time
examples: I can't do everything all at once—you'll have to be patient.

meanings.def: immediately; without delay
examples: Come here at once!

meanings.def: at the same time
examples: Don't all speak at once!
I can't do two things at once.

meanings.def: on this occasion (which is in contrast to what happens usually)
examples: Just for once he arrived on time.
Can't you be nice to each other just this once?

meanings.def: said by an auctioneer to show that an item has been sold
one more time; another time
examples: Once again the train was late.
Let me hear it just once more.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody cannot change
examples: Once an actor, always an actor.

meanings.def: after an unpleasant experience you are careful to avoid something similar
now and for the last time; finally or completely
examples: We need to settle this once and for all.

meanings.def: very rarely
occasionally
examples: Everybody makes a mistake once in a while.

meanings.def: a few times
examples: I don't know her well, I've only met her once or twice.

meanings.def: used to say that somebody has done something wrong or stupid again, and this time they will suffer because of it
examples: You've tried that trick once too often.

meanings.def: used, especially at the beginning of stories, to mean ‘a long time ago in the past’
examples: Once upon a time there was a beautiful princess.
All at once she lost her temper.
I can't do everything all at once—you'll have to be patient.
Come here at once!
Don't all speak at once!
I can't do two things at once.

idioms.def: on this occasion (which is in contrast to what happens usually)
examples: Just for once he arrived on time.
Can't you be nice to each other just this once?

idioms.def: said by an auctioneer to show that an item has been sold

examples: Once again the train was late.
Let me hear it just once more.

now and for the last time; finally or completely

I don't know her well, I've only met her once or twice.

examples: You've tried that trick once too often.

idioms.def: used, especially at the beginning of stories, to mean ‘a long time ago in the past’
examples: Once upon a time there was a beautiful princess.

meanings.def: as soon as; when
examples: We didn't know how we would cope once the money had gone.
The water is fine once you're in!
